org.opentcs.util.math

Interface Matrix<E>

  • Type Parameters:
    E - The matrix's elements' type.
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    GenericMatrix

    public interface Matrix<E>
    A matrix containing elements of a generic type.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void clear()
      Clears all positions of this matrix.
      void fill(E value)
      Fills all positions of this matrix with the given value.
      E getElement(int x, int y)
      Returns the element at the given position, or null, if the given position is empty.
      int getXDimension()
      Returns the number of elements on this matrix's X axis.
      int getYDimension()
      Returns the number of elements on this matrix's Y axis.
      void setElement(int x, int y, E value)
      Sets the element at the given position.
      java.lang.Object[][] toArray()
      Returns a copy of this matrix as a two-dimensional array.
      <T> T[][] toArray(T[][] array)
      Returns a copy of this matrix as a two-dimensional array.
      Matrix<E> transpose()
      Returns the transpose of this matrix.

    • Method Detail

      • getXDimension

        int getXDimension()
        Returns the number of elements on this matrix's X axis.
        Returns:
        The number of elements on this matrix's X axis.

      • getYDimension

        int getYDimension()
        Returns the number of elements on this matrix's Y axis.
        Returns:
        The number of elements on this matrix's Y axis.

      • getElement

        E getElement(int x,
             int y)
        Returns the element at the given position, or null, if the given position is empty.
        Parameters:
        x - The X coordinate of the element to be returned.
        y - The Y coordinate of the element to be returned.
        Returns:
        The element at the given position, or null, if the given position is empty.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - If either parameter is out of the bounds of the represented matrix.

      • setElement

        void setElement(int x,
                int y,
                E value)
         throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
        Sets the element at the given position.
        Parameters:
        x - The element's X coordinate.
        y - The element's Y coordinate.
        value - The value to set the element at the given position to.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - If either parameter is out of the bounds of the represented matrix.

      • clear

        void clear()
        Clears all positions of this matrix. Calling this method is effectively the same as calling fill(E) with a null argument.

      • fill

        void fill(E value)
        Fills all positions of this matrix with the given value.
        Parameters:
        value - The value fill this matrix with.

      • transpose

        Matrix<E> transpose()
        Returns the transpose of this matrix.
        Returns:
        The transpose of this matrix.

      • toArray

        java.lang.Object[][] toArray()
        Returns a copy of this matrix as a two-dimensional array.
        Returns:
        A copy of this matrix as a two-dimensional array.

      • toArray

        <T> T[][] toArray(T[][] array)
        Returns a copy of this matrix as a two-dimensional array. The runtime type of the returned array is that of the specified array.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the array's elements.
        Parameters:
        array - The array defining the runtime type of the returned array.
        Returns:
        A copy of this matrix as a two-dimensional array.
